column4: Just a quick question: Is the Intel 4965 driver in Ubuntu's repository so it is easy to install?
it works in the default install.  no additional stuff necessary
apparently not for me with the live CD of gutsy
the driver is not listed in the Restricted Drivers Manager
well, yes, but are you sure it isnt a Beta or Release Candidate CD?
its not a Restricted Driver.  It's a kernal module
a bit odd as the previous one, 3945, showed up as a restricted driver
perhaps that was before Intel went open source.  all of their wifi drivers are open source and included in gutsy
well in that case I need to check the version of gutsy, but I am pretty sure it is 7.10 final
and it doesn't recognise the card at all?
ifconfig shows a wlan0. Could that be it?
yep.  unless you have another wifi card in
excellent! Then all is set and I can safely install Ubuntu on this computer. Thanks
one more question: Is there a more graphic tool to connect to a ISP with PPPoE than pppoeconf ?
sorry, don't know.  I haven't used PPPoE
